com.qtplaf.library.task

Class TaskRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qtplaf.library.task.TaskRunner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Task, java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileCopy, FileScanner, SampleTask, TaskAverages, TaskCopy, TaskDownloadTicker, TaskRunnerList, TaskRunnerThreads, TaskScanner

    public abstract class TaskRunner
extends java.lang.Object
implements Task
    Base task implementation. Extender must implement the abstract methods:
    • countSteps()
    • execute()
    • isCancelSupported()
    • isDeterminate()
    • isPauseSupported()
    To execute the task call the run() method, not the execute() that is called whithin run(), tracking several issues like termination and exceptions.

    Pause/resume and cancel support is recomended be managed through the usage at the begining of the main loop of,

    • if (checkCancel()) break;
    • if (checkPause()) continue;
    because updating the internal cancelled and paused is not permited.
    Author:
    Miquel Sas

        Previous executed step, necessary in task pools where tasks notify steps at a discretional pace.

      • notifyModulus

        private int notifyModulus
        Notify modulus to notify steps at the give pace. A task can have a huge number of steps and there is no need to notify all them.

        private boolean notifyStep
        A boolean to indicate if the incoming step should be notified by means of the notify modulus.

      • checkCancel

        protected boolean checkCancel()
        Convenience method to deal with cancel requests when cancel is supported. Usage: at the begining of the main loop, if check break the loop.

        if (checkCancel()) break;

        Returns:
        A boolean indicating that cancel has been accepted and processing should terminate.

      • checkPause

        protected boolean checkPause()
        Convinience method to deal with pause/resume requests when pause/resume is supported. Usage: at the begining of the main loop, if check continue.

        if (checkPause()) continue;

        Returns:
        A boolean indicating that pause has been accepted and processing should pause.

        protected void notifyStepCount(long steps)
        Invoked to notify that the non indeterminate task is going to executed the argument number of steps.
        Parameters:

      • notifyStepStart

        protected void notifyStepStart(long step,
                               java.lang.String text)
        Invoked to notify that the step is going to start. Note that steps should start at 1 and end at the total number of steps to properly manage notification modulus and monitor.
        Parameters:
        step - The next step.
        text - The text explaining the step.

      • notifyStepEnd

        protected void notifyStepEnd()
        Invoked to notify that the current step being executed has ended.
